edu.biu.scapi.primitives.prf.openSSL

Class OpenSSLHMAC

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.primitives.prf.openSSL.OpenSSLHMAC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Mac, UniqueTagMac, Hmac, PrfVaryingInputLength, PseudorandomFunction, MacSignSecLevel, OneTime, SecurityLevel, UnlimitedTimes

    public class OpenSSLHMAC
extends java.lang.Object
implements Hmac
    Concrete class of PRF family for Hmac. This class wraps the implementation of OpenSSL library.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OpenSSLHMAC()
      Default constructor that uses SHA1.
      OpenSSLHMAC(CryptographicHash hash)
      This constructor gets a SCAPI CryptographicHash to be the underlying hash and retrieves the name of the hash in order to create the related OpenSSL's hash.
      OpenSSLHMAC(CryptographicHash hash, java.security.SecureRandom random)
      This constructor gets a random and a SCAPI CryptographicHash to be the underlying hash and retrieves the name of the hash in order to create the related OpenSSL's hash.
      OpenSSLHMAC(java.lang.String hashName)
      This constructor receives a hashName and builds the underlying hmac according to it.
      OpenSSLHMAC(java.lang.String hashName, java.security.SecureRandom random)
      This constructor receives an hashName and build the underlying hmac according to it.
      OpenSSLHMAC(java.lang.String hashName, java.lang.String randNumGenAlg)
      This constructor receives an hashName and build the underlying hmac according to it.

      An object trying to use an instance of prf needs to check if it has already been initialized.

      Computes the hmac operation on the given msg and return the calculated tag.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OpenSSLHMAC

        public OpenSSLHMAC()
        Default constructor that uses SHA1.

      • OpenSSLHMAC

        public OpenSSLHMAC(java.lang.String hashName)
            throws FactoriesException
        This constructor receives a hashName and builds the underlying hmac according to it. It can be called from the factory.
        Parameters:
        hashName - - the hash function to translate into OpenSSL's hash.
        Throws:
        FactoriesException - if there is no hash function with given name.

      • OpenSSLHMAC

        public OpenSSLHMAC(java.lang.String hashName,
           java.lang.String randNumGenAlg)
            throws FactoriesException,
                   java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This constructor receives an hashName and build the underlying hmac according to it. It can be called from the factory.
        Parameters:
        hashName - - the hash function to translate into OpenSSL's hash.
        randNumGenAlg - - the random number generator algorithm to use.
        Throws:
        FactoriesException - if there is no hash function with given name.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if there is no random algorithm with the given name.

      • OpenSSLHMAC

        public OpenSSLHMAC(java.lang.String hashName,
           java.security.SecureRandom random)
            throws FactoriesException
        This constructor receives an hashName and build the underlying hmac according to it. It can be called from the factory.
        Parameters:
        hashName - - the hash function to translate into OpenSSL's hash.
        random - - the random object to use.
        Throws:
        FactoriesException - if there is no hash function with given name.

            throws FactoriesException
        This constructor gets a SCAPI CryptographicHash to be the underlying hash and retrieves the name of the hash in order to create the related OpenSSL's hash.
        Parameters:
        hash - - the underlying hash to use
        Throws:
        FactoriesException - if there is no hash function with given name.

      • OpenSSLHMAC

        public OpenSSLHMAC(CryptographicHash hash,
           java.security.SecureRandom random)
            throws FactoriesException
        This constructor gets a random and a SCAPI CryptographicHash to be the underlying hash and retrieves the name of the hash in order to create the related OpenSSL's hash.
        Parameters:
        hash - - the underlying hash to use.
        random - the random object to use.
        Throws:
        FactoriesException - if there is no hash function with given name.

      • computeBlock

        public void computeBlock(byte[] inBytes,
                int inOff,
                byte[] outBytes,
                int outOff)
                  throws javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This function is provided in the interface especially for the sub-family Prp, which have fixed input/output lengths. Since in this case the input is not fixed, it must be supplied and this function should not be called. If the user still calls this function, throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        computeBlock in interface PseudorandomFunction
        Parameters:
        inBytes - input bytes to compute
        inOff - input offset in the inBytes array
        outBytes - output bytes. The resulted bytes of compute
        outOff - output offset in the outBytes array to put the result from
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException

      • computeBlock

        public void computeBlock(byte[] inBytes,
                int inOff,
                int inLen,
                byte[] outBytes,
                int outOff,
                int outLen)
                  throws javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This function is provided in the interface especially for the sub-family PrfVaryingIOLength, which have varying input/output lengths. Since in this case the output variable is fixed this function should not normally be called. If the user still wants to use this function, the specified argument outLen should be the same as the result of getMacSize from BC, otherwise, throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        computeBlock in interface PseudorandomFunction
        Parameters:
        inBytes - input bytes to compute
        inLen - the length of the input array
        inOff - input offset in the inBytes array
        outBytes - output bytes. The resulted bytes of compute
        outOff - output offset in the outBytes array to put the result from
        outLen - the length of the output array
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException

      • computeBlock

        public void computeBlock(byte[] inBytes,
                int inOffset,
                int inLen,
                byte[] outBytes,
                int outOffset)
        Computes the function using the secret key. The user supplies the input byte array and the offset from which to take the data from. Also since the input is not fixed the input length is supplied as well. The user also supplies the output byte array as well as the offset. The computeBlock function will put the output starting at the offset.
        Specified by:
        computeBlock in interface PseudorandomFunction
        Parameters:
        inBytes - input bytes to compute
        inLen - the length of the input array
        inOffset - input offset in the inBytes array
        outBytes - output bytes. The resulted bytes of compute
        outOffset - output offset in the outBytes array to put the result from

      • mac

        public byte[] mac(byte[] msg,
         int offset,
         int msgLen)
        Computes the hmac operation on the given msg and return the calculated tag.
        Specified by:
        mac in interface Mac
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to operate the mac on.
        offset - the offset within the message array to take the bytes from.
        msgLen - the length of the message.
        Returns:
        byte[] the return tag from the mac operation.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(byte[] msg,
             int offset,
             int msgLength,
             byte[] tag)
        Verifies that the given tag is valid for the given message.
        Specified by:
        verify in interface Mac
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to compute the mac on to verify the tag.
        offset - the offset within the message array to take the bytes from.
        msgLength - the length of the message.
        tag - the tag to verify.
        Returns:
        true if the tag is the result of computing mac on the message. false, otherwise.
